subject: Re: [junit] assertEqual and assertSame
msgSnippet: ... I would look at the source code, if I were you. When comparing objects, assertEquals() uses equals(); whereas assertSame() uses ==. ... new
messageBody:
cute4gerbil wrote:

> Hi,
> can anyone tell me what is the different between the use of
> assertEqual and assertSame.

I would look at the source code, if I were you.

When comparing objects, assertEquals() uses equals(); whereas
assertSame() uses ==.

> can u give me a example how they are being used differently.

new Integer(27).equals(new Integer(27)) is true; but
new Integer(27) == new Integer(27) is false
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
